com.expertdesk.edplus
Class EntryIterator

java.lang.Object
  com.expertdesk.edplus.EntryIterator

public class EntryIterator
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.util.Iterator<com.remedy.arsys.api.Entry>, java.lang.Iterable<com.remedy.arsys.api.Entry>

This class implements an Iterator and Iterable to iterate entries in an AR System form.

Author:
Hugo Visser

setQualification

public void setQualification(java.lang.String qualification)
                      throws com.remedy.arsys.api.ARException
Set a qualification. Note that when using field names in the qualification, the field names will be matched to the field label on the first view that matches the locale of the ARServerUser context.

Parameters:
qualification -
Throws:
com.remedy.arsys.api.ARException - when the qualification cannot be parsed.

setFastFail

public void setFastFail(boolean fastFail)
Set the fast failing behaviour of the iterator, default is false. When fast failing is enabled, the iterator will throw a ConcurrentModificationException if entries are added to the form or deleted from the form that is being iterated. Basically the number of matching items must not change while iterating the form. Using remove() or removeEntry() is the correct way to remove an entry while iterating the form. Fast failing can impact performance as the total number of entries is retrieved when a new chunk of data is queried.

Parameters:
fastFail - set to true for fast failing behaviour, false otherwise.

the number of entries that have matched the query

                 throws com.remedy.arsys.api.ARException,
                        java.lang.IllegalStateException
Removes the current entry

Throws:
com.remedy.arsys.api.ARException - if an AR System error occurs

setEntryListFieldInfo

Set the fields that should be returned for each entry or null to return all fields

Parameters:
fieldList - the fields to return

setEntryListFieldInfo

public void setEntryListFieldInfo(long... fieldIds)
Set the fields that should be returned for each entry. This is a convenience method so that you can use 
 EntryIterator itr = ...
 itr.setEntryListFieldInfo(1,8);
in stead of: 
 EntryIterator itr = ...
 itr.setEntryListFieldInfo(new EntryListFieldInfo[] {new EntryListFieldInfo(new FieldID(1)), new EntryListFieldInfo(new FieldID(8))});

Parameters:
fieldIds - the fields to return
See Also:
setEntryListFieldInfo(EntryListFieldInfo[])
